topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5477cf976368725a0ed10000#post_5477cf976368725a0ed10000
[bq="Shadow the Hedgehog"]"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5477ce76636872290e0d0000#post_5477ce76636872290e0d0000
Well, you two are second cousins, there is nothing to worry about.
[spoiler]Well, if you are expecting a baby,  he/she can have little problems, but nothing to worry about.[/spoiler][/bq]
Science-hero to the rescue!
*sounds of subatomic particles-wave pairs' wavelengths being put through sound synthesizer as my theme music and people singing random physics equations as my theme song* 
Actually nope; only progenitor-progeny are the only dangerous ones; everything else is extremely neglible.  Progenitory-progeny relationships' offspring's potential negative genetic side effects can be prevented by genetic testing embryos to see if the embryo has two of the same sets of dna; the chances of this is one in four; if the embryo doesn't then the chances of negative side effects is significantly lower.  If anyone here is in a progenitor-progeny relationship please be aware of the dangers of potential progeny without genetic testing the embryo first, but honestly I think that should be the default for any parent is that if they can afford genetic testing then they should be aware of any potentially negative traits beforehand.

SCIENCE-HERO AWAY!
*flies off using a jetpack*
